message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this product which I believe is of great value to you. I'm offering it to you for $120. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?
Bob, I appreciate your offer, but I need to make a bit more than $90 for this product. I'm willing to come down to $105. Is that something we can work with?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I was thinking more along the lines of $95. Would you be willing to meet me there?
Bob, I understand your position. I'm willing to come down to $100, but I can't go any lower than that. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to you.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I was thinking more along the lines of $92. Would you be willing to meet me there?
Bob,  I'm getting the feeling we might be stuck. Let's split the difference. I'll go down to $96, but that's my final offer.
I appreciate your efforts, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Would you be willing to meet me there?
